meanings.definition: A type of fish found in cold freshwater lakes.
meanings.sent1: The ciscoes swam gracefully in the lake.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen caught many ciscoes for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The ciscoes had a meeting to discuss their next swimming route.
meanings.sent4: The shimmering scales of the ciscoes reflected the sunlight like tiny mirrors.
meanings.sent5: Children love to watch the colorful ciscoes darting around in the water.

meanings.definition: Plural form of cisco, referring to multiple fish of the same species.
meanings.sent1: The lake was teeming with ciscoes of all sizes.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen caught a net full of ciscoes.
meanings.sent3: The ciscoes held a race to see who was the fastest swimmer.
meanings.sent4: The market was bustling with buyers eager to purchase fresh ciscoes.
meanings.sent5: The ciscoes moved in unison, creating a mesmerizing underwater dance.

meanings.definition: The act of catching or fishing for ciscoes.
meanings.sent1: Fishing for ciscoes requires patience and skill.
meanings.sent2: The competition was fierce during the annual ciscoes fishing tournament.
meanings.sent3: The ciscoes outsmarted the fishermen by hiding in the underwater caves.
meanings.sent4: The old man shared his secret recipe for cooking ciscoes with his grandson.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the fishing boat engine scared away the ciscoes, making them harder to catch.
